messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] How long does it take for a message to post?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Shannon if you are new to this group you may still have been on moderated status.  The moderators (I m not one btw) do this for several reasons.  One is to
messages.messageBody:
On 8/27/06, Shannon <dez.shannon@...> wrote:
> When do messages post? I've posted several message to this group and
> NONE of them have posted. (Not even sure if this will, but I guess
> I'll find out.)

Shannon if you are new to this group you may still have been on
moderated status. The moderators (I'm not one btw) do this for
several reasons. One is to make sure that the people subscribing
really are parents wanting to know about homeschoolers (vs. spammers
wanting a market) and the other is so that if someone new to
unschooling posts something that might get what might feel like harsh
responses (did you follow that LOL!) that they can post it for you
anonymously. Sometimes those new to unschooling feel crticized until
they get to know the tone of the list members and the way in which
"answers" are given.

Looks like you are off moderation now. And then sometimes yahoogroups
is just SO darn slow in responding!

--
Michelle
aka Melbrigða
http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com
MedHS@yahoogroups.com - Homeschooling for the Medieval Recreationist
